msContents.summary: Side 1 (Recto): Qur’an 18,47 (45) (beginning of line 6) - 49 (47). Traces of another line. Side 2 (Verso): Qur’an 18,51 (49) (end of line 5) - 55 (53) (traces of two other lines.)

msItemStruct.note: Text is on both sides, 17 lines written on each side. Script reminiscent of nos. 10-13 in the Chicago Collection and no.21 in the Vatican Library. Diacritical marks used. Kufic characters. Parallel strokes mark verse divisions. (S.L. Skoss)
Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Ellen W. Harrison Collection

supportDesc.support: 26.8 x 32.7cm. White, thin parchment. Almost the full length and the full width are preserved but the upper side is badly damaged: the first 6 lines (as well as parts of lines 7-9) are entirely destroyed, and only the margins remain. The lower part is also damaged.

provenance.p: Purchased from Professor Bernhard Moritz of Cairo through W.M. Mueller, 1910.
